net.metarelate.terminology.coreModel
Interface BackgroundKnowledgeManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
BackgroundKnowledgeManagerTDBImpl
public interface BackgroundKnowledgeManager

This class handles "background knowledge". This is intended as information that can be used by the TerminologyServer, but it is not part of its content. One example of usage of this class would be to store (and query) configuration options, or for instance the URLs where a term representation is published. Labels, which could be rightfully handled via this class, are instead handled via a specific class LabelManager, that can provide more specialized methods (e.g. labels by language, list of supported languages...). The remit of the BackgroundKnowledgeManager is very broad, and as such, its functionalities are very basic. In the current implementation, it only returns a Jena Model that hold the set of statements that constitute of background knowledge. More specialized methods (add/set/inspect) would be possible, but they bring scarce utility in the current implementation. TODO In the current version of the prototype, this class in not in use (though it should be once the publishing layer is re-factored)

Author:
andrea_splendiani
